wikipedia_page.main: John Charles Badcock (17 January 1903 – 29 May 1976), also known as Felix Badcock, was a British rower who competed in the 1928 Summer Olympics and in the 1932 Summer Olympics.

link_mentions.page: Great Britain at the 1932 Summer Olympics
response: * Coxless four - John Badcock, Jack Beresford, Hugh Edwards, and Rowland George - Gold

link_mentions.page: Great Britain at the 1928 Summer Olympics
response: * Eight - crew from Thames Rowing Club comprising Jamie Hamilton, Guy Oliver Nickalls, John Badcock, Donald Gollan, Harold Lane, Gordon Killick, Jack Beresford, Harold West and Arthur Sulley
